entries.title: AI web app complete and deployment
entries.whats_new: The AI-powered changelog web app has been finished, enabling automatic summarization of GitHub commits; APIs are deployed on Railway with front-end on Vercel; unnecessary codes have been cleaned.
entries.breaking_change: The web app now automatically summarizes changes based on Git commits, which may alter how users review changelogs; deployment on Railway and Vercel improves accessibility.
entries.impact: Users will experience more streamlined and up-to-date changelogs automatically generated from commit data, improving clarity and efficiency.

entries.title: Enhanced configuration capabilities for users
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI models, API keys, and other settings, providing greater flexibility and customization.
entries.breaking_change: The API has been updated to allow users to set up their own configurations for GitHub repositories and AI models, which may affect existing setups if they're not reconfigured.
entries.impact: Users can personalize their changelog generation environment, enabling more tailored and secure integrations.

entries.title: Implemented back-end JSON cache strategy
entries.whats_new: Back-end API now generates a JSON cache file that the front-end loads to display the changelog; layout changed to center; icon updated to Greptile.
entries.breaking_change: The changelog data is now fetched from a cached JSON file instead of real-time API calls, which may introduce slight delays in updates but improves performance.
entries.impact: Users may see faster load times for changelogs, with the trade-off of changes appearing after cache regeneration.

entries.title: Support for user configuration of repositories and API keys
entries.whats_new: Users now have the ability to configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI models, API keys, and other settings to customize the changelog process.
entries.breaking_change: Users can set their own repositories and API keys, potentially impacting previously configured or hardcoded setups if not reconfigured properly.
entries.impact: This change allows for more flexible and secure management of integrations, giving users control over their data sources and AI processing.

entries.title: Interface management and UI polishing
entries.whats_new: Interfaces are consolidated into one file for easier management; home page decorations and loading effects added; changelog detail page allows clicking to view detailed logs.
entries.breaking_change: The layout of the changelog detail page has changed to enable navigation to detailed entries, which may alter user experience.
entries.impact: Users can now navigate more intuitively through changelog entries and enjoy enhanced visuals.

entries.title: Introduction of JSON cache for API
entries.whats_new: API generates a JSON file as a cache for the changelog data, which the front-end loads; layout adjusted; icon changed to Greptile.
entries.breaking_change: Changelog data retrieval now relies on cached JSON files instead of real-time API responses, making updates depend on cache refreshes.
entries.impact: Speedier loading of changelogs for users, with minor delays in reflecting the latest changes until cache updates.
